Q1: What is Michael Govan's current position?
A1: Michael Govan is the director of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA).

Q2: Where was Michael Govan born?
A2: Michael Govan was born in North Adams, Massachusetts.

Q3: What was Michael Govan's role at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation?
A3: Michael Govan was the deputy director of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum under Thomas Krens from 1988 to 1994.

Q4: What is the name of the new gallery building designed by Peter Zumthor that Michael Govan is planning to construct?
A4: The new gallery building designed by Peter Zumthor that Michael Govan is planning to construct is called the "Zumthor Project."

Q5: How much has Michael Govan raised for LACMA in his first three full years as director?
A5: In his first three full years as director of LACMA, Michael Govan raised $251 million.

Q6: What is the name of the museum that Michael Govan proposed merging with LACMA in 2013?
A6: The museum that Michael Govan proposed merging with LACMA in 2013 was the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles (MOCA).

Q7: How much commitments has Michael Govan raised for the Zumthor Project as of January 2017?
A7: As of January 2017, Michael Govan had raised about $300 million in commitments for the Zumthor Project.

Q8: What is the expected completion date of the Zumthor Project?
A8: The expected completion date of the Zumthor Project is 2023.

Q9: How will the collection be organized after the merger with MOCA?
A9: After the merger with MOCA, the collection will be organized into a non-departmental art museum.

Q10: What is Michael Govan's personal life like?
A10: Michael Govan is married and has two daughters, and he used to live in a $6 million mansion provided by LACMA until the museum decided to sell the property to make up for its debt of almost $900 million. He now lives in a trailer park in Malibu.

Q1: Who is the executive director of the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School?
A1: Dana Blankstein-Cohen.

Q2: When was Dana Blankstein appointed as the executive director of the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School?
A2: In November 2019.

Q3: What is Dana Blankstein's profession?
A3: She is a film director and an Israeli culture entrepreneur.

Q4: Where was Dana Blankstein born?
A4: Switzerland.

Q5: When did Dana Blankstein move to Israel?
A5: In 1983.

Q6: What is the name of the film school where Dana Blankstein is the executive director?
A6: Sam Spiegel Film and Television School.

Q7: What are some of the films directed by Dana Blankstein?
A7: Tel Aviviot (mini-series), Growing Pains (graduation film), and Camping (debut film).

Q8: When did Dana Blankstein direct the mini-series "Tel Aviviot"?
A8: 2012.

Q9: What is the name of the graduation film directed by Dana Blankstein?
A9: Growing Pains.

Q10: When did Dana Blankstein direct her debut film, "Camping"?
A10: 2006.
